text:
The third quartile is the point below which 75% of the observations lie. Recognizing
that there are 10 observations in the data set, the third quartile can be identified as:
1, = (10+1)x = 8.25
100
When the data is arranged in ascending order, the third quartile is one-fourth (0.25)
of the way from the eighth data point (18%) to the ninth data point (19%), or
18.25%. This means that 75% of all observations lie below 18.25%.
